task_summary: Remove the lid from the pot, place the pot onto the plate, then grasp the spatula and use it to push the pot toward the front edge of the table.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop manipulation scene with a robot arm, a small pot with a lid, a round plate area on a tan board, and a spatula tool. The robot must first uncover the pot by opening its lid, then grasp the pot and set it onto the plate area. After that, the robot switches to tool use: it grasps the spatula and pushes the pot toward the table’s front (toward the camera). Actions should be sequential and perception-led with moderate timeouts.
preconditions: Pot, lid, plate area, and spatula are visible on the table
stepwise_plan: Detect pot and lid; open the pot’s lid.
Detect plate; compute grasp and pick the pot.
Raise and place the pot onto the plate area.
Push the pot toward the front of the table using the spatula.
Place down the spatula and retreat.
success_criteria: Pot is resting on the plate area
Pot has been pushed toward the front edge of the table
failure_and_recovery: If lid opening fails, re-detect lid and retry open.
If grasp fails, recompute grasp pose and retry.
If push does not move pot sufficiently, perform another push with the tool.
If perception is uncertain, repeat detection.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the pot is on the plate and has been pushed frontward, with the tool placed down and the arm retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: Arm aligned near pot/plate; indicates transition from lid removal to pot manipulation.

frame_5.now_evidence: Spatula visible under gripper; shows tool-use phase start.
frame_5.predicts_next: Push on pot using the tool.

frame_2.now_evidence: Lid offset above pot; consistent with opening action.
frame_2.predicts_next: Proceed to pick and place pot.

frame_6.now_evidence: Tool contacting pot; active push underway.

task_instruction: Take the lid off the pot, put the pot on the plate, and use the tool to push to pot to the front of the table.

node_specs.description: Vision detect a named target with a timeout.
Open a container or remove its lid.
Compute a grasp pose for an object and store it to a blackboard key.
Execute a grasp using a stored pose.
Place a held object on a named surface area.
Push a target using a specified handheld tool.
Place down the currently held object.
Back off from the workspace after completion.

failure_modes: Failed pot grasp or slip during lift
Pot misplaced off the plate area
Tool grasp failure or ineffective push
recovery_strategy: Re-detect and retry open with slightly increased timeout
Recompute grasp pose and retry grasp
Re-place pot with corrected yaw and gentle press force
Perform an additional push cycle toward the front
assumptions: Plate is the round tan area on the board; frames support pot placement there.
Front-of-table corresponds to direction_deg 180 in the task frame.
Using the spatula as the tool is consistent with frames showing spatula under the gripper.

expected_success_criteria: Lid is no longer on pot
Pot rests stably within the plate area
Pot position advances toward front after push
Tool released and robot clear of objects
